title: Debian
data:
[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Debian](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search/Debian "wikipedia:Special:Search/Debian")***

**Debian** is a [free](/wiki/Free "Free") operating system. Debian works exceptionally well as a [server](/wiki/Server "Server"); Debian GNU/Linux is the operating system underneath [nethack.alt.org](/wiki/Nethack.alt.org "Nethack.alt.org"). Debian also powers some desktops, though many users have [Ubuntu](/wiki/Ubuntu "Ubuntu"), a variant of Debian that makes frequent releases of the most important software.

Debian GNU/Linux is exceptional because it supports 11 processor architectures and has more than 18 thousand packages. No other distribution of [GNU](/wiki/GNU "GNU") and [Linux](/wiki/Linux "Linux") is more comprehensive; perhaps only [NetBSD](/wiki/NetBSD "NetBSD") can claim to support more processor architectures than Debian.

Debian also does a great job of providing current versions of packages (in the "unstable" repository, because Debian sometimes waits almost three years between releases). The current version in "stable" is [3.6.6](/wiki/NetHack_3.6.6 "NetHack 3.6.6"). All current Debian versions also contain the final release of [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), 0.0.7E7F3.

The Debian NetHack package is maintained by Vincent Cheng and James Cowgill.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

Perhaps a fortune cookie could read:

- `They say that Debian and Gentoo are the best at providing current versions of packages.`

They have Debian GNU/kFreeBSD and Debian GNU/Hurd too.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"Someone familiar with Debian needs to update this article. Someone familiar with NAO needs to update the information about NAO's operating system (or delete it, if you prefer.) [Furey](/wiki/User:Furey "User:Furey") ([talk](/wiki/User_talk:Furey "User talk:Furey")) 00:11, 27 June 2024 (UTC)"*

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Patches](#Patches)
- [2 Messages](#Messages)
- [3 See also](#See_also)
- [4 References](#References)

## Patches

Debian used to bundle a large number of [patches](/wiki/Patch "Patch") to [NetHack 3.4.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.4.3 "NetHack 3.4.3"),[\[2\]](#cite_note-2) providing features ranging from simple UI enhancements and bug fixes to changes that affect the game play. Some of the larger patches include [hpmon](http://bilious.alt.org/?45), [menucolors](/wiki/Menucolors "Menucolors"), [sortloot](http://bilious.alt.org/?42), [dump](http://bilious.alt.org/?40) and a modified version of [paranoid](http://bilious.alt.org/?44)

The `95_enh_engulf_prayers.dpatch` patch makes being engulfed a major trouble, so that a successful prayer while engulfed will get you expelled and cause the [engulfing](/wiki/Engulfing "Engulfing") monster to [flee](/wiki/Flee "Flee").

## Messages

The patches applied to the Debian version of NetHack 3.4.3 included these messages:

- You hear a \<growl\_sound> of divine fear!

  You are [engulfed](/wiki/Engulf "Engulf") in an [animal](/wiki/Animal "Animal"), have successfully prayed and are about to get expelled. The [growl\_sound](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/src/sounds.c#growl_sound "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/src/sounds.c") refers to whatever sound that monster makes when it growls.

* You feel a strange distortion in your surroundings!

  You are engulfed in something other than an animal, have successfully prayed and are about to get expelled.

- \<monster> looks rather nauseated.

  The animal that had engulfed you is now fleeing.

* \<monster> looks rather shook up.

  The non-animal monster that had engulfed you is now fleeing.

## See also

- [Official site](http://www.debian.org/)

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [Debian -- Details of package nethack-common in bookworm](https://packages.debian.org/stable/nethack-common)
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [Debian patch list for 3.4.3](https://sources.debian.org/patches/nethack/3.4.3-15/)
html:
Debian

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Wikipedia has an article about:
Debian

Debian is a free operating system. Debian works exceptionally well as a server; Debian GNU/Linux is the operating system underneath nethack.alt.org. Debian also powers some desktops, though many users have Ubuntu, a variant of Debian that makes frequent releases of the most important software.

Debian GNU/Linux is exceptional because it supports 11 processor architectures and has more than 18 thousand packages. No other distribution of GNU and Linux is more comprehensive; perhaps only NetBSD can claim to support more processor architectures than Debian.

Debian also does a great job of providing current versions of packages (in the "unstable" repository, because Debian sometimes waits almost three years between releases). The current version in "stable" is 3.6.6. All current Debian versions also contain the final release of SLASH'EM, 0.0.7E7F3.

The Debian NetHack package is maintained by Vincent Cheng and James Cowgill.[1]

Perhaps a fortune cookie could read:

They say that Debian and Gentoo are the best at providing current versions of packages.

They have Debian GNU/kFreeBSD and Debian GNU/Hurd too.

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"Someone familiar with Debian needs to update this article. Someone familiar with NAO needs to update the information about NAO's operating system (or delete it, if you prefer.) Furey (talk) 00:11, 27 June 2024 (UTC)"

Contents

  • 1 Patches
  • 2 Messages
  • 3 See also
  • 4 References

Patches

Debian used to bundle a large number of patches to NetHack 3.4.3,[2] providing features ranging from simple UI enhancements and bug fixes to changes that affect the game play. Some of the larger patches include hpmon, menucolors, sortloot, dump and a modified version of paranoid

The 95_enh_engulf_prayers.dpatch patch makes being engulfed a major trouble, so that a successful prayer while engulfed will get you expelled and cause the engulfing monster to flee.

Messages

The patches applied to the Debian version of NetHack 3.4.3 included these messages:

You hear a <growl_sound> of divine fear!
You are engulfed in an animal, have successfully prayed and are about to get expelled. The growl_sound refers to whatever sound that monster makes when it growls.
You feel a strange distortion in your surroundings!
You are engulfed in something other than an animal, have successfully prayed and are about to get expelled.
<monster> looks rather nauseated.
The animal that had engulfed you is now fleeing.
<monster> looks rather shook up.
The non-animal monster that had engulfed you is now fleeing.

See also

  • Official site

References

  1. ↑ Debian -- Details of package nethack-common in bookworm
  2. ↑ Debian patch list for 3.4.3
